poem:
**The Mummy's Awakening**

Sand swirls,  
an ancient city breathes—  
under the skin of desert,  
relics whisper secrets.  
A hot lunk, a sexy nerd,  
embark where spirits churn.  
Glimmers in sunlit eyes,  
they chase past's echo,  
careless of curses and love,  
at crossroads—  
where heartbeats quicken,  
dust rises, lush dreams awaken  
in the ruins of knowing.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "A relic of horny Hollywood: why The Mummy remains a classic bisexual awakening movie At the threshold between life and death sits the ancient Egyptian city of Hamunaptra … and at the threshold of many a millennial adolescence (including mine) sits 1999’s The Mummy, a story about a hot lunk (Brendan Fraser) and a sexy nerd (Rachel Weisz) learning first-hand the consequences of expatriating cultural artefacts. A turn-of-the-millennium Spielbergian blockbuster with shades of the superhero". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: A relic of horny Hollywood: why The Mummy remains a classic bisexual awakening movie At the threshold between life and death sits the ancient Egyptian city of Hamunaptra … and at the threshold of many a millennial adolescence (including mine) sits 1999’s The Mummy, a story about a hot lunk (Brendan Fraser) and a sexy nerd (Rachel Weisz) learning first-hand the consequences of expatriating cultural artefacts. A turn-of-the-millennium Spielbergian blockbuster with shades of the superhero
